thread.title: Livestock agent fined $1,500 for transporting animals unfit for travel
thread.title_full: Livestock agent fined $1,500 for transporting animals unfit for travel

author: Emma Brown
title: Livestock agent fined $1,500 for transporting animals unfit for travel
text:
Map: Mildura 3500 
A livestock agent in northern Victoria has been fined for transporting animals unfit for travel. 
The Echuca Magistrate's Court fined the agent $1,500 after two cows had to be put down on arrival at a processing facility with advanced lumpy jaw lesions and a septic leg. 
John Ryan from Agriculture Victoria said unscrupulous individuals may risk animal welfare as the price of livestock increases but he is confident the regulation system is working. 
"They need to make sure that the animals they are transporting are fit to load and that there aren't any animal welfare issues," he said. 
"The producers, agents, truck drivers, everybody involved in the cattle industry need to consider that they have to protect the industry as far as exports and overseas countries looking at our activities. 
"There's still a few cowboys out there that think that they can make a dollar out of anything they can find. 
"But we are not going to put up with that sort of activity and if people are found contravening the act we will take action against them."
